page.title: 10Fishing from Blackhead
page.content: The Blackhead is a bleak outcast headland near the town of St.Austell, Cornwall.It is something about this headland that attracts people whether it is to ramble over the rocks and isolated beaches or to fish in the heavily over-populated mackeral runs, the Blackhead has had thousands of feet trample it's coast.Visitors and Cornishmen alike come here to marvel at the barren,jagged coastline. Fishermen from all parts congregate here.They fish with floats because unless you can cast 300yards weights are hopeless thanks to the deep,dense kelp beds.On a good day you can go home with a bag full.On a bad day normally loads and loads of garfish, exciting to a visitor,a pest to a local.People socialise with stories of the one that got away and "have you caught anything"in different accents.
